fevga.json.description: Greek variant similar to Moultezim and Narde. Features no hitting and players move in the same direction.

movement.description: Both players move in the same direction (clockwise)

bearing_off.description: All pieces must be in home board before bearing off

forced_moves.description: Must use all dice if possible

gioul.json.description: Gioul originated in Turkey and is played throughout the Middle East. Combines features of Plakoto, Moultezim, and Gul Bara.

movement.description: White moves from 24 to 1, black moves from 1 to 24

hitting.description: Cannot hit opponent pieces. Single checkers pin opponent pieces instead.

bearing_off.description: All pieces must be in home board before bearing off

forced_moves.description: Must use all dice if possible

gul-bara.json.description: Turkish variant similar to Moultezim. One checker controls a point and doubles are very powerful.

movement.description: Both players move in the same direction (clockwise)

hitting.description: No hitting allowed in Gul Bara

bearing_off.description: All pieces must be in home board before bearing off

forced_moves.description: Must use all dice if possible

hyper-backgammon.json.description: Hyper-Backgammon variant played with only three checkers per player.

movement.description: White moves from 24 to 1, black moves from 1 to 24

hitting.description: Hitting a single opponent piece sends it to the bar

movement.doubles_rule: When doubles are rolled (e.g., 2-2), the player gets 4 moves of that value instead of 2

combined_moves.description: Players can use the sum of both dice in a single normal move (e.g., 2+3=5); no combined enter or bear-off.

movement.description: White moves from 24 to 1, black moves from 1 to 24. Players must use all dice before their turn ends.

hitting.description: Hitting a single opponent piece sends it to the bar

bearing_off.description: All pieces must be in home board (points 1-6 for white, 19-24 for black) before bearing off

forced_moves.description: Must use all dice if possible, and must use higher die if only one can be used
